this depends. a gun in the home of an uneducated idiot, will probably end up hurting somebody that is not intended to be hurted. a gun that is locked up, wont do you a bit of good. but a gun in the hands of an educated individual is the safest thing in the world. thats why instead of gun control, we should be pushing for gun education.

Well I cant tell if you are serious or are being sarcastic but this will also tell everyone who comes accross it.
 
 Ron Dixon is a computer egineer and a Veteran of the U.S. Navy where he was a munitions expert. He has 2 children and a girlfriend. One night Ivan Thompson 40 (a man with a 14 page rap sheet) broke into his house. Mr. Dixon found him at the door of his two year old son's room and shot him twice with a legally purchased 9mm that was in the process of being registered according to state law. The registration had not gone through yet but he had done everything necessary, just waiting on the registration. 
 Then the Brooklyn DA (Hynes to be exact) decided to charge him for possesion of an un-registered firearm which carries a 1 year prison sentence. Mr. Dixon's Attorney Andrew Friedman has said that any ammount of time behind bars is unacceptable and I tend to agree. 
 You can contact the Brooklyn DA's office (Hynes does not have a direct emial to him) schmetj@brooklynda.org or you can call 
 (718) 250-2300
 Your support is appreciated.
DAs are political people. Any amount of attention to this case would help Ron Dixon.
